intro: Centaurium cachanlahuen, commonly known as the Chilean centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Centaurium cachanlahuen is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
